topics.body:
I hate it when someone uses the term "general knowledge".
I mean, there is no such thing as knowledge that is general.

Let's make Obama as an example. Obama is the President. Some say that is general knowledge. That's not true. Why? Imagine 70% of people know that Obama is the President. What about the other 30%? What if, one day, someone asks who is the President and you couldn't answer because you're one of the 30%? They would either laugh, tease or insult you for not knowing something that is "general knowledge". They would go on and say "How would you NOT know that?! Its general knowledge!"

It's just... fucked.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5532f9e16368722773030a00#post_5532f9e16368722773030a00

That term refers more to something that is commonly known by a majority of people. Majority does not equate everyone.

Taking your example. The majority of people know Obama is the president of the US. The majority of people know 1 + 1 equals 2.

topics.body:
A bit of talk about the news; it's pretty apparent what is going to be the next big social war in the usa now that gay marriage is mostly done now that the lawyer against gay marriage in the supreme court case metaphorically fucked the dog on his case (for those non-americans it's a rarely used american slang for whenever has a easy job to do and completely and utterly fucks up hard).

What is going to be the next big social war in politics?  Easy: marijuana

Why?  Cause even though like 52 of the usa is in support of legalization that is low enough still to create a large scale moral panic in politics that politicians can run on both for and against legalization.


Basically 2018/2020 usa elections are going to have no mention of gay marriage cause it'll be legalized already, but instead the next big fight will be "stop persecuting potheads!" vs "potheads will destroy america!"
